title: I.Sicily inscription 001087
support: Large block of yellow tuff, broken in 8 pieces when found, subsequently restored and set together in plaster. Most of the block is preserved, damaged at the left and right ends, with some of the left half of the face and lower edge missing. The inscribed field (108 cm wide) is cut back from the right and left margins; the upper surface is finished with traces of clamp holes for the fitting of a block above. The rear is uneven.

layout.p: 11 lines of Greek, filling the finished recessed field from the top and extending fully to both margins, with vacat at the end of the last line and below.

provenanceFound._: Found by Cavallari in 1871 in the left anta of the entrance to the adyton of Temple G (Zeus), Selinunte

provenanceObserved._: On display, ground floor, Palermo archaeological museum

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Antonino Salinas
museum.description: Partially reopened following extensive restoration work. Comprehensive collection of archaeological material, predominantly from the West of the island, with an important Etruscan collection.

location.address: Centre of Palermo, Piazza Olivella 24, 90100 - Palermo

διὰ το̄̀ς θεο̄̀ς το̄́σδε νικο͂ντι τοὶ Σελινο̄́ν τιοι διὰ τὸν Δία νικο͂μες καὶ διὰ τὸν Φόβον καὶ διὰ hερακλέα καὶ δι’ Ἀπόλλο̄να καὶ διὰ Ποτ ειδᾶνα καὶ διὰ Τυνδαρίδας καὶ δι᾿ Ἀθα ναίαν καὶ διὰ Μαλοφόρον καὶ διὰ Πασικ ράτειαν καὶ διὰ το̄̀ς ἄλλο̄ς θεο̄̀ς διὰ δὲ Δία μάλιστα φιλίας δὲ γενομένας ἐν χρυσ έο̄ι ἐλάμεν τὰ δ᾿ ἔτι ὀνύματα ταῦτα κολ άψαντες εἰς τὸ Ἀπολλο̄́νιον κάθθεμε ν τὸ Διὸς προγράψαντες τὸ δὲ χρυσίον hεξε̄́κοντα ταλάντο̄ν ἐ͂μεν
Text of IGPalermo

It is through the gods listed here that the Selinuntines win victory. Through Zeus we conquer and through Phobos and through Herakles and through Apollo and through Poseidon and through the Tyndaridai and through Athena and through Malophoros and through Pasikrateia and through the other gods, but through Zeus above all. Since there is friendship (it is resolved), that having forged in gold, and having engraved these names, to dedicate in the Apollonion, having written the name of Zeus in first place; and that the gold be sixty talents.
